[[File:III.jpg|left|thumbnail]]

question.title: Question
question.description: In the photograph/video of extrinsic/intrinsic III paralysis, which of the following is a common misconception about the presentation of the condition?

option_a.title: Option A
option_a.description: The affected individual exhibits ptosis in the unaffected eye due to the paralysis of the third nerve.

option_b.title: Option B
option_b.description: The patient experiences double vision (diplopia) when looking inward, as the medial rectus muscle is paralyzed.

option_c.title: Option C
option_c.description: The pupil of the affected eye is dilated and non-reactive to light due to parasympathetic fiber involvement in the third cranial nerve.

option_d.title: Option D
option_d.description: The affected eye is unable to move laterally, up, or down due to the paralysis of the lateral and superior rectus muscles.
